instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115-A fan spin, green light, no chime, no image
threads.message:
Hi, got an 820-3115-A board that had loads of humidity. Managed to get it to fan spin, but there's no chime and no image, no USB power and no green light on Caps Lock. 

 i get every rail but 820-3115-A is 1.1v.

ALL_SYS_PWRGD is 3.3v

PLT_RESET_L is 3.3v

Tried several different BIOS chips no change.

threads.title: 820-3115-A fan spin, green light, no chime, no image
threads.message:
"i get every rail but 820-3115-A is 1.1v."
Did you want to say VCORE?

Try one RAM module at time.
Check the slots with DDR3 test card.

threads.title: 820-3115-A fan spin, green light, no chime, no image
threads.message:
Yes, VCORE sorry.

Cleaned the RAM Slots, tried both ram slots with different sticks, no change. Even without RAM still behaves the same, no beeps.

threads.title: 820-3115-A fan spin, green light, no chime, no image
threads.message:
Bad contacts on RAM slots not always cause classic RAM error beeps.

Possibly accumulated crap under PCH, or CPU.
You should also reball SMC.

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
